channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Hot americano and an egg': Chinese employee fired for refusing to serve boss
item.description: In Shanghai, a new employee was briefly fired after refusing to buy breakfast for her supervisor. She shared her experience on social media, leading to public condemnation and the supervisor's termination. The company reinstated the employee and acknowledged that the firing did not comply with their policy, raising awareness about workplace bullying.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa SpaceX Crew-9 launch: When and where to watch including launch timing, location and live streaming
item.description: Nasa is set to launch the SpaceX Crew-9 mission on Saturday, bringing astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore back from the ISS. The mission includes transporting Nick Hague and Aleksandr Gorbunov to the ISS for a five-month stay. Live coverage starts at 9:00 am EDT, with docking expected on Monday.
item.dc:creator: TOI Science Desk

item.title: Poo-nami in China: Sewage explodes sending feces up in air, pedestrians, cars drenched
item.description: A sewage pipe explosion in Nanning, China resulted in human feces being shot 33 feet into the air, drenching pedestrians and vehicles. The incident occurred during a pressure test on newly-installed pipes. No injuries were reported, but the force was strong enough to flip a digger. Cleanup operations began immediately.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hot microphones and no live audience: What are the rules for CBS vice presidential debate?
item.description: JD Vance and Tim Walz, running mates for Donald Trump and Kamala Harris respectively, are set to debate on October 1. The event starts at 9 pm ET and is hosted by CBS News with moderators Norah O’Donnell and Margaret Brennan. Notably, there will be no live audience, and the format includes closing statements only.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Over 40 dead as Hurricane Helene leaves trail of destruction across Southeastern US
item.description: Hurricane Helene hit Florida's Big Bend region and spread devastation up to the Appalachian Mountains. The storm led to over 40 deaths across four states, causing severe flooding, dam failures, landslides, and extensive power outages. Emergency services conducted rescue operations as authorities issued evacuation warnings for several affected communities.

item.title: UK considered ‘aquatic raid’ on Netherlands to seize Covid vaccine AstraZeneca: Boris Johnson
item.description: In his memoir, former UK PM Boris Johnson disclosed that during the pandemic, he explored an aquatic raid on a Dutch warehouse to obtain AstraZeneca vaccines. The plan was discussed with military leaders in March 2021 and involved using boats and lorries to retrieve and transport the urgently needed vaccines back to the UK.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan: Punjab government imposes section 144 ahead of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf's rally
item.description: The Punjab government has imposed Section 144 in Rawalpindi district for two days, restricting public gatherings ahead of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf's rally at Liaquat Bagh. The ban covers all types of assemblies and weapon displays on September 28 and 29. PTI had initially sought permission for the rally but later withdrew its plea.

item.title: Musk faces $1.8 million fine for reinstatement of X in Brazil
item.description: Elon Musk has been ordered to pay a $1.8 million fine to lift the ban on X in Brazil. The Brazilian court had shut down the platform after Musk refused to remove right-wing accounts and failed to appoint a legal representative. The company is now complying with the court's orders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bad news for Trump? Why former US president vowed to prosecute Google if re-elected
item.description: Donald Trump has vowed to prosecute Google if he is re-elected, claiming the search engine shows only negative stories about him while favoring Kamala Harris. Google denied these allegations, asserting that both candidates' websites appear at the top for relevant searches. Trump did not provide any evidence to support his claims.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diplomats walkout during Netanyahu's speech as Israeli airstrikes rage across Lebanon
item.description: Diplomats exited during Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's UN General Assembly speech, protesting Israel's military actions in Gaza and Lebanon. Netanyahu committed to ongoing strikes on Hezbollah in Lebanon despite international cease-fire efforts. The Gaza conflict has led to extensive destruction and displacement over nearly a year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I couldn't wait ...': Reporter halts live broadcast, jumps into water to save drowning woman
item.description: FOX Weather meteorologist Bob Van Dillen paused his live coverage of Hurricane Helene in Atlanta to save a woman trapped in her car by rising floodwaters. He carried her to safety before first responders could arrive. The hurricane left extensive damage and claimed at least 44 lives across Florida and the southeastern US.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New York mayor pleads not guilty to fraud and bribery charges
item.description: New York mayor Eric Adams has pleaded not guilty to charges of fraud and bribery in a Manhattan federal court. Prosecutors allege he accepted illegal gifts from Turkish associates for political favors. If convicted, Adams could face up to 45 years in prison. The next hearing is scheduled for Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: '5,000-pound bunker busters': Iran condemns US 'complicity' in Israeli strikes; top developments
item.description: Iran condemned the US for supporting Israeli airstrikes on Gaza and Lebanon, accusing Israel of using American-supplied bombs. Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was reportedly targeted but is believed to be safe. The US denied prior knowledge of the strikes, while President Biden directed adjustments to US forces in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Sheikh Hassan Nasrallah? Hezbollah leader who was target of Israeli strikes
item.description: Israeli airstrikes targeted Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut, resulting in numerous deaths and injuries. Despite the attack, Nasrallah is confirmed to be alive. This marks a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, with substantial impacts on both sides of the confrontation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ready to back Bangladesh reforms: UN
Communication with Hezbollah's senior leader cut off after Israeli airstrike in Beirut
item.description: Israeli airstrikes on Beirut’s southern suburbs have disrupted communication with Hezbollah’s senior leadership. The attacks targeted Hezbollah’s headquarters, causing significant damage and injuries. In retaliation, Hezbollah launched rockets towards northern Israel. This escalation raises concerns about the group’s operational capabilities and strategic direction in the ongoing conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hezbollah launches 'rocket salvos' at Israel following IDF airstrikes on Beirut
item.description: The Israeli military and Hezbollah engaged in strikes on Friday. Hezbollah targeted Safed in northern Israel with rockets, causing property damage but no injuries. This was a response to an earlier Israeli airstrike on Hezbollah’s southern Beirut headquarters, which resulted in casualties and destruction. The conflict has led to a humanitarian crisis with many displaced.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Gen Z Is reviving the values of 1971': Muhammad Yunus praises Bangladesh youth at UNGA
item.description: Muhammad Yunus, chief advisor to Bangladesh's interim government, praised the youth-led protests that led to Sheikh Hasina’s removal. Speaking at the UN General Assembly, he highlighted Generation Z's role in reviving values from Bangladesh’s 1971 independence and expressed hope for a prosperous future under new leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: P Diddy: TikToker says Feds mistook liquid Ecstasy for 1,000 bottles of baby oil
item.description: ​"If baby oil was a big part of these parties & all the things that Diddy did to his victims, some celebrity would have made a joke about it here & there. We'd have heard about it," the TikToker said on the most sensational piece of information that came out after Diddy's arrest that 1,000 bottles of baby oil were found from Diddy's mansion.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Doug Emhoff slams Trump's remarks as 'vile antisemitic things'
item.description: Doug Emhoff criticised former President Donald Trump's comments as antisemitic and dangerous for Jewish Americans. At a Jewish event in Washington, Trump warned that Israel's existence would be threatened if Vice President Kamala Harris won the upcoming election. Emhoff urged Americans to combat antisemitism and hate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
